@graph.description:
Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs). PadFISH is a multiplex padlock probe-based smFISH method that integrates the hybridization-based in situ sequencing (HybISS) and the single-cell resolution in situ hybridization on tissues (SCRINSHOT). In this study, we employed this technique to trace nascent RNAs using intronic padlock probes (PLPs) targeting their cDNA and to detect their rolling circle amplification (RCA) product through subsequent Bridge Probe (BP) and Detection Oligo (DO) hybridization
For padFISH we used fixed cells stored in PBS. Cells underwent permeabilization with 0.1 M HCl for 3 minutes at room temperature (RT), followed by three 1-minute washes in PBS/Tween 0.05% (PBST). Subsequently, blocking mix with 20% formamide was added for 30 minutes at RT, then washed twice for 1 minute with PBST. When needed, primary probes were phosphorylated via T4 Polynucleotide Kinase (cat. M0201S, New England Biolabs); non-radioactive phosphorylation reaction was carried at 37°C for 30 minutes according to manufacturer’s protocol. For PLP hybridization, we applied a solution containing 20% formamide and 50 nM of each probe, then incubated the slides for 15 minutes at 55 °C followed by 2 hours at 45 °C. After hybridization, cells were washed three times for 10-minute with 10% formamide in 2x SSC at 45 °C, and then three times for 1-minute with PBST. To ligate standard PLPs, the sample was incubated with 0.5 U/ml of SplintR ligase (cat. #M0375L, New England Biolabs) for 15 minutes at 25 °C. After ligation, cells were washed twice for 1 minute in PBST. RCA was performed by incubating the sample overnight at 30 °C with NxGen Phi29 DNA polymerase (cat. #30221-2, LGC Biosearch Technologies) and 0.1 uM RCA primer (purchased as 100 nmol DNA oligonucleotide from IDT). To ligate PLPs with a single RNA-nucleotide, cells were incubated with 0.5 U/ml T4 RNA ligase (cat. #M0239L, New England Biolabs) and in presence of 0.1 uM RCA primer for 2h at 37°C. Afterwards, cells were washed twice for 1 minute in PBST. RCA was performed as described above, only in absence of RCA primer. After RCA, cells were washed three times for 1 minute in PBST and subsequently fixed in 4% PFA for 15 minutes at RT. After three additional PBST washing steps, cells were incubated with 65% formamide in 2x SSC at 30 °C. Usual PBST washes and an additional washing step in 2x SSC were carried out before secondary hybridization. BP and DO hybridization were performed according to the L-probes HybISS Protocol (Gyllborg et. al, 2020). For BP hybridization, we added a solution of 4x SSC, 40% formamide and 0.1 M of each barcode 0.1 mM to the wells and incubated them for 1 hour at RT. Excess probes were removed by washing with 2x SSC. DO hybridization using 0.1 mM of each barcoded dye was carried out simultaneously with 5 uM DAPI staining for 1 hour at RT. Excess DOs were removed by washing three times with PBS and cells were stored in PBS at 4 °C until imaging.

@graph.description: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs). For immunofluorescence (IF), fixed cells were permeabilized in ice-cold 0.2% Triton-X in PBS for 5 minutes, then blocked with 10% goat serum (GS) in PBS for 15 minutes. Incubation with primary antibody (NF-κB p65 (D14E12) XP Rabbit mAb, cat. #8242, Cell Signaling Technologies) diluted 1:500 with 10% GS in PBS was performed for 1 h. Cells were washed twice with 0.002% NP-40 detergent solution in PBS for 5 minutes. Next, the secondary antibody (Goat anti-Rabbit IgG (H+L) labeled with Alexa Fluor 647 (Invitrogen, cat. #A21244, lot. #2836809) was diluted with 10% GS in PBS and added to the sample for 30 minutes. After two 5-minute washing steps in PBS, cells were incubated with 5 uM DAPI in PBS for 15 minutes and then washed three times in PBS. All steps were performed at room temperature. IF samples were stored in PBS at 4°C until imaging.

@graph.description:
Multicolor images were acquired for DAPI (λex = 405 nm, λem = 445±23 nm) and Alexa Fluor 647 (λex = 637 nm, λem = 685±23.5 nm). All images were recorded in Imaris format at 16-bit depth and with 1024x1024 pixels dimensions (pixel size: 0.1204 um) using an iXon Ultra 888 EM-CCD camera. Tiles were recorded as z-stack of 10 um thickness with a step size of 0.4 um (26 frames) and with 10% overlap. Samples were imaged in PBS. 
Acquisition order and channel-target combination: 637 nm for NF-kB-p65, 405 nm for cell nuclei (DAPI).
@graph.labEquipment: Andor Dragonfly 505 spinning disk confocal unit equipped with a Nikon Ti2-E inverted microscope and a 100x CFI SR HP Plan Apochromat Lambda S silicone immersion objective.
@graph.name: NF-kB immunofluorescence

@graph.description:
Multicolor images were acquired for DAPI (λex = 405 nm, λem = 445±23 nm), ATTO 550 (λex = 561 nm, λem = 594±21.5 nm) and Alexa Fluor 647 (λex = 637 nm, λem = 685±23.5 nm). All images were recorded in Imaris format at 16-bit depth and with 1024x1024 pixels dimensions (pixel size: 0.217 μm) using an iXon Ultra 888 EM-CCD camera. Tiles were recorded as z-stack of 10 um thickness with a step size of 0.4 um (26 frames) and with 10% overlap. Samples were imaged in PBS.

Acquisition order and channel-gene combination:
- 637 nm for CXCL8, 405 nm for cell nuclei (DAPI) - all replicates
- 637 nm for SELE, 405 nm for cell nuclei (DAPI) - all replicates
- 561 nm for SAMD4A, 405 nm for cell nuclei (DAPI) - all replicates
@graph.labEquipment: Samples were imaged using an Andor Dragonfly 505 spinning disk confocal unit equipped with a Nikon Ti2-E inverted microscope and a Plan Apo 60x/1.40 oil objective.

@graph.description:
Multicolor images were acquired for DAPI (λex = 405 nm, λem = 445±23 nm), Alexa Fluor 488 (λex = 488 nm, λem = 521±19 nm), ATTO 550 (λex = 561 nm, λem = 594±21.5 nm), Alexa Fluor 647 (λex = 637 nm, λem = 685±23.5 nm) and Alexa Fluor 750 (λex = 730 nm, λem = 809±45 nm). All images were recorded in Imaris format at 16-bit depth and with 1024x1024 pixels dimensions (pixel size: 0.217 μm or 0.1204 um) using an iXon Ultra 888 EM-CCD camera. Tiles were recorded as z-stack of 10 um thickness with a step size of 0.4 um (26 frames) and with 10% overlap. Samples were imaged in PBS.

Acquisition order and channel-gene combination (all replicates): 730 nm for CXCL3, 637 nm for CXCL8, 561 nm for CXCL2, 488 nm for CXCL1, 405 nm for cell nuclei (DAPI).
@graph.labEquipment: Andor Dragonfly 505 spinning disk confocal unit equipped with a Nikon Ti2-E inverted microscope and a Plan Apo 60x/1.40 oil objective (Rep1-2) or a 100x CFI SR HP Plan Apochromat Lambda S silicone immersion objective (Rep3).
